item.title: Research highlights
item.description: Post-doctoral research # Direct Visual Alignment from Spherical Images Provide a high resolution orientation estimation based on omnidirectional images mapped on a subdivided icosahedron. Visual Gyroscope 3-step pipeline for omnidirectional images stabilization To be presented in CVPR OmniCV 2023 Workshop Ph.D. research # Encoded Periodic pattern for nanometric pose estimation on decimetric range Pose estimation process, ($a$) acquired target image, ($b$) Modulus of the 2D discrete Fourier transform. Circles exhibit the two frequency peaks of the two directions of the target image.

item.title: Softwares
item.description: Vernier Library # Link to Github repository The Vernier Library is an open-source C++ library for pose measurement of calibrated patterns with subpixel resolutions. The library gathers a collection of classes for detection and rendering different kind of calibrated patterns (periodic patterns, megarena patterns, QR-code-like and bitmap patterns). LibPeR # Link to Github repository LibPeR Library is an open-source C++ library for handling large field-of-view cameras applied to visual servoing and visual alignment contexts.

item.title: Teaching and supervision
item.description: Computer vision practical courses (2018 - 2021) # Courses given to Master 2 ENSMM students (final year of engineering school), for a total of 108 hours along the three years of teaching. Practical courses goals # Teach the basics of computer vision theory applied to practical cases with 3 separate courses (4h each) The courses include the following topics : Camera calibration Homography and patching an image in an other Stereo vision with a triangulation problem Courses contains some classic examples of computed vision applications such as panoramic photography, photogrammetry, RANSAC, structure from motion etc.
